page.title: 08Stagsden People
page.content: The population of the parish in 1981 was 347 in 139 households.The largest age group was those of pensionable age, 96 people (27%).There were 42 children under the age of 10 and 66 under 15. The occupations are varied ranging from traditional agricultural activities (14 farmers and 6 farm workers)through to various trades and professions. The village has a blacksmith, a garage proprietor,a pig breeder, market gardener, egg farmer, tree surgeon, landscape gardener, postmistress,postlady and publican all working locally.Others travel to Bedford or as far afield as London for occupations which include banking, journalism, civil service,and civil engineering.In 1981 55% of households lived in owner ocuppied property and 22% rented from the council.
